name: df-lmhm
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(clmhm, cmpo(s0, s1, clmod, clmod, crab(s2, co(cv(s0), cghm, cv(s1)), wsbc(s3, cfv(csca, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cfv(csca, cv(s1)), cv(s3)), wral(s4, cfv(cbs, cv(s3)), wral(s5, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s5))), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s5)))))))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ LMHom =(s0 ∈ LMod, s1 ∈ LMod ↦ { s2 ∈(s0[GrpHom]s1)|[(Scalar ` s0)/ s3]((Scalar ` s1)= s3 ∧ ∀(s4 ∈(Base ` s3), ∀(s5 ∈(Base ` s0),(s2 `(s4[(× ` s0)]s5))=(s4[(× ` s1)](s2 ` s5)))))})
comment: A homomorphism of left modules is a group homomorphism which additionally preserves the scalar product. This requires both structures to be left modules over the same ring. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Dec-2014.)
